Decision Trees

A decision tree is a binary structure where each node best splits the data to classify a response variable. It starts with a root node and ends with final nodes known as leaves of the tree. A hypothetical tree can be designed based on characteristic information such as skin colour, hair length, weight, and height to determine whether a new person is male or female.
